alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:41PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Marion, northwestern Fayette and northern Lamar Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 841 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beaverton, or 7 miles northeast of Sulligent, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Sulligent, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Crews, Bluff, Twin, Tucker, Henson Springs, Wayside, Byrd, Pine Springs, Marion County Public Lake and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
